message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We used data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the International Finance Corporation's Doing Business Indicators to explore the relationship between regulations, informal payments and firm performance in low-and-middle income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "International Finance Corporation's Doing Business Indicators"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Using a cross-sectional dataset of small and medium-sized firms across Tanzania, we investigate the effects of managerial networks on firms' innovation output.", "dataset": ["cross-sectional dataset of small and medium-sized firms"], "topic": ["Innovation", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs individual-level panel data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) to estimate the causal impacts of child mortality on fertility decisions in 42 developing countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We matched information on disease outbreaks worldwide with flight itinerary datasets provided by the International Air Transport Association to analyze how air travel affects the geographic spread of infectious diseases.", "dataset": ["flight itinerary datasets provided by the International Air Transport Association"], "topic": ["Health", "Transport"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes how the adoption of precision agriculture technologies influences farm productivity and profitability using a unique farm-level dataset from Brazil.", "dataset": ["unique farm-level dataset from Brazil"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the effects of climate change on electricity demand, we use a combination of temperature and precipitation data from the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts and hourly electricity consumption data from the Energy Information Administration.", "dataset": ["European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts", "Energy Information Administration"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We examined the relationship between maternal and child health outcomes and exposure to air pollution in India using a dataset that combines satellite-based data on particulate matter concentrations with survey data from the India Human Development Survey.", "dataset": ["satellite-based data on particulate matter concentrations", "survey data from the India Human Development Survey"], "topic": ["Environment", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses household-level data on energy consumption, demographic characteristics, and dwelling attributes from the National Household Energy Survey to estimate the welfare impacts of energy price increases in South Africa.", "dataset": ["National Household Energy Survey"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using a panel dataset of firms in Indonesia and a difference-in-differences strategy, we investigate the effects of a reduction in the corporate tax rate on firm-level investment.", "dataset": ["panel dataset of firms in Indonesia"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the relationship between social protection programs and employment outcomes, we combine data from the Demographic and Health Surveys and the World Bank's Social Protection and Labor Database.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "World Bank's Social Protection and Labor Database"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Social Protection"]}]
